00036 // this funky union is used for fast 16-bit pixel format conversions
00037 typedef union
00038 {
00039       struct
00040       {
00041             UINT16      usLower;
00042             UINT16      usHigher;
00043       };
00044       UINT32      uiValue;
00045 } SplitUINT32;

00047 HIMAGE CreateImage( SGPFILENAME ImageFile, UINT16 fContents )
00048 {
00049       HIMAGE                  hImage = NULL;
00050       SGPFILENAME Extension;
00051       CHAR8                   ExtensionSep[] = ".";
00052       STR                           StrPtr;
00053       UINT32                  iFileLoader;
00054 
00055       // Depending on extension of filename, use different image readers
00056       // Get extension
00057       StrPtr = strstr( ImageFile, ExtensionSep );
00058 
00059       if ( StrPtr == NULL )
00060       {
00061             // No extension given, use default internal loader extension
00062             DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_2, "No extension given, using default" );
00063             strcat( ImageFile, ".PCX" );
00064             strcpy( Extension, ".PCX" );
00065       }
00066       else
00067       {
00068             strcpy( Extension, StrPtr+1 );
00069       }
00070 
00071       // Determine type from Extension
00072       do
00073       {
00074             iFileLoader = UNKNOWN_FILE_READER;
00075  
00076             if ( _stricmp( Extension, "PCX" ) == 0 )
00077             {
00078                   iFileLoader = PCX_FILE_READER;
00079                   break;
00080             }
00081 
00082             if ( _stricmp( Extension, "TGA" ) == 0 )
00083             {
00084                   iFileLoader = TGA_FILE_READER;
00085                   break;
00086             }
00087 
00088             if ( _stricmp( Extension, "STI" ) == 0 )
00089             {
00090                   iFileLoader = STCI_FILE_READER;
00091                   break;
00092             }
00093 
00094       } while ( FALSE );
00095 
00096       // Determine if resource exists before creating image structure
00097       if ( !FileExists( ImageFile ) )
00098       {
00099             //If in debig, make fatal!
00100 #ifdef JA2
00101 #ifdef _DEBUG
00102             //FatalError( "Resource file %s does not exist.", ImageFile );
00103 #endif
00104 #endif
00105             DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String("Resource file %s does not exist.", ImageFile) );
00106             return( NULL );
00107       }
00108 
00109       // Create memory for image structure
00110       hImage = (HIMAGE)MemAlloc( sizeof( image_type ) );
00111 
00112       AssertMsg( hImage, "Failed to allocate memory for hImage in CreateImage");
00113       // Initialize some values
00114       memset( hImage, 0, sizeof( image_type ) );
00115             
00116       //hImage->fFlags = 0;
00117       // Set data pointers to NULL
00118       //hImage->pImageData = NULL;
00119       //hImage->pPalette   = NULL;
00120       //hImage->pui16BPPPalette = NULL;
00121 
00122       // Set filename and loader
00123       strcpy( hImage->ImageFile, ImageFile );
00124       hImage->iFileLoader = iFileLoader;
00125 
00126       if ( !LoadImageData( hImage, fContents ) )
00127       {
00128             return( NULL );
00129       }
00130 
00131       // All is fine, image is loaded and allocated, return pointer
00132       return( hImage );
00133 
00134 }
00135 
00136 BOOLEAN DestroyImage( HIMAGE hImage )
00137 {
00138       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00139 
00140       // First delete contents
00141       ReleaseImageData( hImage, IMAGE_ALLDATA );//hImage->fFlags );
00142 
00143       // Now free structure
00144       MemFree( hImage );
00145 
00146       return( TRUE );
00147 }
00148 
00149 BOOLEAN ReleaseImageData( HIMAGE hImage, UINT16 fContents )
00150 {
00151 
00152       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00153       
00154       if ( (fContents & IMAGE_PALETTE) && (hImage->fFlags & IMAGE_PALETTE) )
00155       {
00156             //Destroy palette
00157             if( hImage->pPalette != NULL )
00158             {
00159                   MemFree( hImage->pPalette );
00160                   hImage->pPalette = NULL;
00161             }
00162 
00163             if ( hImage->pui16BPPPalette != NULL )
00164             {
00165                   MemFree( hImage->pui16BPPPalette );
00166                   hImage->pui16BPPPalette = NULL;
00167             }
00168 
00169             // Remove contents flag
00170             hImage->fFlags = hImage->fFlags ^ IMAGE_PALETTE;
00171       }
00172       
00173       if ( (fContents & IMAGE_BITMAPDATA) && (hImage->fFlags & IMAGE_BITMAPDATA) )
00174       {
00175             //Destroy image data
00176             Assert( hImage->pImageData != NULL );
00177             MemFree( hImage->pImageData );
00178             hImage->pImageData = NULL;
00179             if (hImage->usNumberOfObjects > 0)
00180             {
00181                   MemFree( hImage->pETRLEObject );
00182             }
00183             // Remove contents flag
00184             hImage->fFlags = hImage->fFlags ^ IMAGE_BITMAPDATA;
00185       }
00186 
00187       if ( (fContents & IMAGE_APPDATA) && (hImage->fFlags & IMAGE_APPDATA) )
00188       {
00189             // get rid of the APP DATA
00190             if ( hImage->pAppData != NULL )
00191             {
00192                   MemFree( hImage->pAppData );
00193                   hImage->fFlags &= (~IMAGE_APPDATA);
00194             }
00195       }
00196 
00197       return( TRUE );
00198 }
00199 
00200 BOOLEAN LoadImageData( HIMAGE hImage, UINT16 fContents )
00201 {
00202       BOOLEAN fReturnVal = FALSE;
00203 
00204       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00205 
00206       // Switch on file loader      
00207       switch( hImage->iFileLoader )
00208       {
00209             case TGA_FILE_READER:
00210 
00211                   fReturnVal = LoadTGAFileToImage( hImage, fContents );
00212                   break;
00213 
00214             case PCX_FILE_READER:
00215 
00216                   fReturnVal = LoadPCXFileToImage( hImage, fContents );
00217                   break;
00218 
00219             case STCI_FILE_READER:
00220                   fReturnVal = LoadSTCIFileToImage( hImage, fContents );
00221                   break;
00222 
00223             default:
00224 
00225                   DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_2, "Unknown image loader was specified." );
00226 
00227       }
00228       
00229       if ( !fReturnVal )
00230       {
00231             DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_2, "Error occured while reading image data." );
00232       }
00233 
00234       return( fReturnVal );
00235 
00236 }

00238 BOOLEAN CopyImageToBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, UINT32 fBufferType, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect )
00239 {
00240       // Use blitter based on type of image
00241       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00242 
00243       if ( hImage->ubBitDepth == 8 && fBufferType == BUFFER_8BPP )
00244       {
00245             #ifndef NO_ZLIB_COMPRESSION
00246                   if ( hImage->fFlags & IMAGE_COMPRESSED )
00247                   {
00248                         DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_2, "Copying Compressed 8 BPP Imagery." );
00249                         return( Copy8BPPCompressedImageTo8BPPBuffer( hImage, pDestBuf, usDestWidth, usDestHeight, usX, usY, srcRect ) );
00250                   }
00251             #endif
00252 
00253             // Default do here
00254             DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_2, "Copying 8 BPP Imagery." );
00255             return ( Copy8BPPImageTo8BPPBuffer( hImage, pDestBuf, usDestWidth, usDestHeight, usX, usY, srcRect ) );                 
00256 
00257       }
00258 
00259       if ( hImage->ubBitDepth == 8 && fBufferType == BUFFER_16BPP )
00260       {
00261             #ifndef NO_ZLIB_COMPRESSION
00262                   if ( hImage->fFlags & IMAGE_COMPRESSED )
00263                   {
00264                         DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Copying Compressed 8 BPP Imagery to 16BPP Buffer." );
00265                         return ( Copy8BPPCompressedImageTo16BPPBuffer( hImage, pDestBuf, usDestWidth, usDestHeight, usX, usY, srcRect ) );
00266                   }
00267             #endif
00268 
00269             // Default do here
00270             DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Copying 8 BPP Imagery to 16BPP Buffer." );
00271             return ( Copy8BPPImageTo16BPPBuffer( hImage, pDestBuf, usDestWidth, usDestHeight, usX, usY, srcRect ) );
00272 
00273       }
00274 
00275 
00276       if ( hImage->ubBitDepth == 16 && fBufferType == BUFFER_16BPP )
00277       {
00278             #ifndef NO_ZLIB_COMPRESSION
00279                   if ( hImage->fFlags & IMAGE_COMPRESSED )
00280                   {
00281                         DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Automatically Copying Compressed 16 BPP Imagery." );
00282                         return( Copy16BPPCompressedImageTo16BPPBuffer( hImage, pDestBuf, usDestWidth, usDestHeight, usX, usY, srcRect ) );
00283                   }
00284             #endif
00285 
00286                   DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Automatically Copying 16 BPP Imagery." );
00287             return( Copy16BPPImageTo16BPPBuffer( hImage, pDestBuf, usDestWidth, usDestHeight, usX, usY, srcRect ) );
00288       }
00289 
00290       return( FALSE );
00291 
00292 }

00297 BOOLEAN Copy8BPPCompressedImageTo8BPPBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect )
00298 {
00299       UINT32      uiNumLines;
00300       UINT32      uiLineSize;
00301       UINT32            uiCnt;
00302 
00303       UINT8 *     pDest;
00304       UINT32      uiDestStart;
00305       
00306       UINT8 *     pScanLine;
00307 
00308       PTR               pDecompPtr;
00309       UINT32      uiDecompressed;
00310 
00311       // Assertions
00312       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00313       Assert( hImage->pCompressedImageData != NULL );
00314 
00315       // Validations
00316       CHECKF( usX >= 0 );
00317       CHECKF( usX < usDestWidth );
00318       CHECKF( usY >= 0 );
00319       CHECKF( usY < usDestHeight );
00320       CHECKF( srcRect->iRight > srcRect->iLeft );
00321       CHECKF( srcRect->iBottom > srcRect->iTop );
00322 
00323       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "8BPP to 8BPP Compressed Blitter Called!" );
00324       // determine where to start Copying and rectangle size
00325       uiDestStart = usY * usDestWidth + usX;
00326       uiNumLines = srcRect->iBottom - srcRect->iTop;
00327       uiLineSize = srcRect->iRight - srcRect->iLeft;
00328 
00329       Assert( usDestWidth >= uiLineSize );
00330       Assert( usDestHeight >= uiNumLines );
00331 
00332       pDest = (UINT8 *) pDestBuf + uiDestStart;
00333 
00334       // Copying a portion of a compressed image is rather messy
00335       // because we have to decompress past all the data we want
00336       // to skip.
00337 
00338       // To keep memory requirements small and regular, we will
00339       // decompress one scanline at a time even if none of the data will
00340       // be blitted (but stop when the bottom line of the rectangle
00341       // to blit has been done).
00342 
00343       // initialize the decompression routines
00344       pDecompPtr = DecompressInit( hImage->pCompressedImageData, hImage->usWidth * hImage->usHeight );
00345       CHECKF( pDecompPtr );
00346 
00347       // Allocate memory for one scanline
00348       pScanLine = MemAlloc( hImage->usWidth );
00349       CHECKF( pScanLine );
00350 
00351       // go past all the scanlines we don't need to process
00352       for (uiCnt = 0; uiCnt < (UINT32) srcRect->iTop; uiCnt++)
00353       {
00354             uiDecompressed = Decompress( pDecompPtr, pScanLine, hImage->usWidth );
00355             Assert( uiDecompressed == hImage->usWidth );
00356       }
00357 
00358       // now we start Copying
00359       for (uiCnt = 0; uiCnt < uiNumLines - 1; uiCnt++)
00360       {
00361             // decompress a scanline
00362             uiDecompressed = Decompress( pDecompPtr, pScanLine, hImage->usWidth );
00363             Assert( uiDecompressed == hImage->usWidth );
00364             // and blit
00365 //          memcpy( pDest, pScanLine + srcRect->iLeft, uiLineSize );
00366             pDest += usDestWidth;
00367       }
00368       // decompress the last scanline and blit
00369       uiDecompressed = Decompress( pDecompPtr, pScanLine, hImage->usWidth );
00370       Assert( uiDecompressed == hImage->usWidth );
00371 //    memcpy( pDest, pScanLine + srcRect->iLeft, uiLineSize );
00372 
00373       DecompressFini( pDecompPtr );
00374       return( TRUE );
00375 }

00377 BOOLEAN Copy8BPPCompressedImageTo16BPPBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect )
00378 {
00379       UINT32            uiNumLines;
00380       UINT32            uiLineSize;
00381       UINT32            uiLine;
00382       UINT32            uiCol;
00383 
00384       UINT16 *    pDest;
00385       UINT16 *    pDestTemp;
00386       UINT32            uiDestStart;
00387       
00388       UINT8 *           pScanLine;
00389       UINT8 *           pScanLineTemp;
00390 
00391       PTR                     pDecompPtr;
00392       UINT32            uiDecompressed;
00393 
00394       UINT16 *    p16BPPPalette;
00395 
00396       // Assertions
00397       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00398       Assert( hImage->pCompressedImageData != NULL );
00399       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Start check" );
00400       // Validations
00401       CHECKF( usX >= 0 );
00402       CHECKF( usX < usDestWidth );
00403       CHECKF( usY >= 0 );
00404       CHECKF( usY < usDestHeight );
00405       CHECKF( srcRect->iRight > srcRect->iLeft );
00406       CHECKF( srcRect->iBottom > srcRect->iTop );
00407       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "End check" );
00408       p16BPPPalette = hImage->pui16BPPPalette;
00409 
00410       // determine where to start Copying and rectangle size
00411       uiDestStart = usY * usDestWidth + usX;
00412       uiNumLines = srcRect->iBottom - srcRect->iTop;
00413       uiLineSize = srcRect->iRight - srcRect->iLeft;
00414 
00415       Assert( usDestWidth >= uiLineSize );
00416       Assert( usDestHeight >= uiNumLines );
00417 
00418       pDest = (UINT16 *) pDestBuf;
00419       pDest += uiDestStart;
00420       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, String( "Start Copying at %p", pDest ) );
00421 
00422       // Copying a portion of a compressed image is rather messy
00423       // because we have to decompress past all the data we want
00424       // to skip.
00425 
00426       // To keep memory requirements small and regular, we will
00427       // decompress one scanline at a time even if none of the data will
00428       // be blitted (but stop when the bottom line of the rectangle
00429       // to blit has been done).
00430 
00431       // initialize the decompression routines
00432       pDecompPtr = DecompressInit( hImage->pCompressedImageData, hImage->usWidth * hImage->usHeight );
00433       CHECKF( pDecompPtr );
00434 
00435       // Allocate memory for one scanline
00436       pScanLine = MemAlloc( hImage->usWidth );
00437       CHECKF( pScanLine );
00438 
00439       // go past all the scanlines we don't need to process
00440       for (uiLine = 0; uiLine < (UINT32) srcRect->iTop; uiLine++)
00441       {
00442             DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Skipping scanline" );
00443             uiDecompressed = Decompress( pDecompPtr, pScanLine, hImage->usWidth );
00444             Assert( uiDecompressed == hImage->usWidth );
00445       }
00446 
00447       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Actually Copying" );
00448       // now we start Copying
00449       for (uiLine = 0; uiLine < uiNumLines - 1; uiLine++)
00450       {
00451             // decompress a scanline
00452             uiDecompressed = Decompress( pDecompPtr, pScanLine, hImage->usWidth );
00453             Assert( uiDecompressed == hImage->usWidth );
00454             
00455             // set pointers and blit      
00456             pDestTemp = pDest;
00457             pScanLineTemp = pScanLine + srcRect->iLeft;
00458             for (uiCol = 0; uiCol < uiLineSize; uiCol++ )
00459             {
00460                   *pDestTemp = p16BPPPalette[ *pScanLineTemp ];
00461                   pDestTemp++;
00462                   pScanLineTemp++;
00463             }
00464             pDest += usDestWidth;
00465       }
00466       
00467       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, String( "End Copying at %p", pDest ) );
00468       
00469       DecompressFini( pDecompPtr );
00470       return( TRUE );
00471 }

00477       return( FALSE );

00482 BOOLEAN Copy8BPPImageTo8BPPBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect )
00483 {
00484       UINT32 uiSrcStart, uiDestStart, uiNumLines, uiLineSize;
00485       UINT32 cnt;
00486       UINT8 *pDest, *pSrc;
00487 
00488       // Assertions
00489       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00490       Assert( hImage->p16BPPData != NULL );
00491 
00492       // Validations
00493       CHECKF( usX >= 0 );
00494       CHECKF( usX < usDestWidth );
00495       CHECKF( usY >= 0 );
00496       CHECKF( usY < usDestHeight );
00497       CHECKF( srcRect->iRight > srcRect->iLeft );
00498       CHECKF( srcRect->iBottom > srcRect->iTop );
00499 
00500       // Determine memcopy coordinates
00501       uiSrcStart = srcRect->iTop * hImage->usWidth + srcRect->iLeft;
00502       uiDestStart = usY * usDestWidth + usX;
00503       uiNumLines = ( srcRect->iBottom - srcRect->iTop ) + 1;
00504       uiLineSize = ( srcRect->iRight - srcRect->iLeft ) + 1;
00505 
00506       Assert( usDestWidth >= uiLineSize );
00507       Assert( usDestHeight >= uiNumLines );
00508       
00509       // Copy line by line
00510       pDest = ( UINT8*)pDestBuf + uiDestStart;
00511       pSrc =  hImage->p8BPPData + uiSrcStart;
00512 
00513       for( cnt = 0; cnt < uiNumLines-1; cnt++ )
00514       {
00515             memcpy( pDest, pSrc, uiLineSize );
00516             pDest += usDestWidth;
00517             pSrc  += hImage->usWidth;
00518       }
00519       // Do last line
00520       memcpy( pDest, pSrc, uiLineSize );
00521 
00522       return( TRUE );
00523 
00524 }

00526 BOOLEAN Copy16BPPImageTo16BPPBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect )
00527 {
00528       UINT32 uiSrcStart, uiDestStart, uiNumLines, uiLineSize;
00529       UINT32 cnt;
00530       UINT16 *pDest, *pSrc;
00531 
00532       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00533       Assert( hImage->p16BPPData != NULL );
00534 
00535       // Validations
00536       CHECKF( usX >= 0 );
00537       CHECKF( usX < hImage->usWidth );
00538       CHECKF( usY >= 0 );
00539       CHECKF( usY < hImage->usHeight );
00540       CHECKF( srcRect->iRight > srcRect->iLeft );
00541       CHECKF( srcRect->iBottom > srcRect->iTop );
00542 
00543       // Determine memcopy coordinates
00544       uiSrcStart = srcRect->iTop * hImage->usWidth + srcRect->iLeft;
00545       uiDestStart = usY * usDestWidth + usX;
00546       uiNumLines = ( srcRect->iBottom - srcRect->iTop ) + 1;
00547       uiLineSize = ( srcRect->iRight - srcRect->iLeft ) + 1;
00548 
00549       CHECKF( usDestWidth >= uiLineSize );
00550       CHECKF( usDestHeight >= uiNumLines );
00551       
00552       // Copy line by line
00553       pDest = ( UINT16*)pDestBuf + uiDestStart;
00554       pSrc =  hImage->p16BPPData + uiSrcStart;
00555 
00556       for( cnt = 0; cnt < uiNumLines-1; cnt++ )
00557       {
00558             memcpy( pDest, pSrc, uiLineSize * 2 );
00559             pDest += usDestWidth;
00560             pSrc  += hImage->usWidth;
00561       }
00562       // Do last line
00563       memcpy( pDest, pSrc, uiLineSize * 2 );
00564 
00565       return( TRUE );
00566 
00567 }

00582 BOOLEAN Copy8BPPImageTo16BPPBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect )
00583 {
00584       UINT32 uiSrcStart, uiDestStart, uiNumLines, uiLineSize;
00585       UINT32 rows, cols;
00586       UINT8  *pSrc, *pSrcTemp;
00587       UINT16 *pDest, *pDestTemp;
00588       UINT16 *p16BPPPalette;
00589 
00590       
00591       p16BPPPalette = hImage->pui16BPPPalette;
00592 
00593       // Assertions
00594       Assert( p16BPPPalette != NULL );
00595       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00596 
00597       // Validations
00598       CHECKF( hImage->p16BPPData != NULL );
00599       CHECKF( usX >= 0 );
00600       CHECKF( usX < usDestWidth );
00601       CHECKF( usY >= 0 );
00602       CHECKF( usY < usDestHeight );
00603       CHECKF( srcRect->iRight > srcRect->iLeft );
00604       CHECKF( srcRect->iBottom > srcRect->iTop );
00605 
00606       // Determine memcopy coordinates
00607       uiSrcStart = srcRect->iTop * hImage->usWidth + srcRect->iLeft;
00608       uiDestStart = usY * usDestWidth + usX;
00609       uiNumLines = ( srcRect->iBottom - srcRect->iTop );
00610       uiLineSize = ( srcRect->iRight - srcRect->iLeft );
00611 
00612       CHECKF( usDestWidth >= uiLineSize );
00613       CHECKF( usDestHeight >= uiNumLines );
00614       
00615       // Convert to Pixel specification
00616       pDest = ( UINT16*)pDestBuf + uiDestStart;
00617       pSrc =  hImage->p8BPPData + uiSrcStart;
00618       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, String( "Start Copying at %p", pDest ) );
00619 
00620       // For every entry, look up into 16BPP palette
00621       for( rows = 0; rows < uiNumLines-1; rows++ )
00622       {
00623             pDestTemp = pDest;
00624             pSrcTemp = pSrc;
00625 
00626             for ( cols = 0; cols < uiLineSize; cols++ )
00627             {
00628                   *pDestTemp = p16BPPPalette[ *pSrcTemp ];
00629                   pDestTemp++;
00630                   pSrcTemp++;
00631             }
00632 
00633             pDest += usDestWidth;
00634             pSrc  += hImage->usWidth;
00635       }
00636       // Do last line
00637       DbgMessage( TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_3, String( "End Copying at %p", pDest ) );
00638 
00639       return( TRUE );
00640 
00641 }
00642 
00643 UINT16 *Create16BPPPalette( SGPPaletteEntry *pPalette )
00644 {
00645       UINT16 *p16BPPPalette, r16, g16, b16, usColor;
00646       UINT32 cnt;
00647       UINT8  r,g,b;
00648 
00649       Assert( pPalette != NULL );
00650 
00651       p16BPPPalette = (UINT16 *) MemAlloc( sizeof( UINT16 ) * 256 );
00652 
00653       for ( cnt = 0; cnt < 256; cnt++ )
00654       {
00655             r = pPalette[ cnt ].peRed;
00656             g = pPalette[ cnt ].peGreen;
00657             b = pPalette[ cnt ].peBlue;
00658 
00659             if(gusRedShift < 0)
00660                   r16=((UINT16)r>>abs(gusRedShift));
00661             else
00662                   r16=((UINT16)r<<gusRedShift);
00663 
00664             if(gusGreenShift < 0)
00665                   g16=((UINT16)g>>abs(gusGreenShift));
00666             else
00667                   g16=((UINT16)g<<gusGreenShift);
00668 
00669 
00670             if(gusBlueShift < 0)
00671                   b16=((UINT16)b>>abs(gusBlueShift));
00672             else
00673                   b16=((UINT16)b<<gusBlueShift);
00674 
00675             usColor = (r16&gusRedMask)|(g16&gusGreenMask)|(b16&gusBlueMask);
00676 
00677             if(usColor==0)
00678             {
00679                   if((r+g+b)!=0)
00680                         usColor=BLACK_SUBSTITUTE | gusAlphaMask;
00681             }
00682             else
00683                   usColor |= gusAlphaMask;
00684 
00685             p16BPPPalette[ cnt ] = usColor;
00686       }
00687 
00688       return( p16BPPPalette );
00689 }
00690 
00691 /**********************************************************************************************
00692  Create16BPPPaletteShaded
00693       
00694       Creates an 8 bit to 16 bit palette table, and modifies the colors as it builds.     
00695       
00696       Parameters:
00697             rscale, gscale, bscale: 
00698                         Color mode: Percentages (255=100%) of color to translate into destination palette.
00699                         Mono mode:  Color for monochrome palette.
00700             mono:
00701                         TRUE or FALSE to create a monochrome palette. In mono mode, Luminance values for 
00702                         colors are calculated, and the RGB color is shaded according to each pixel's brightness.
00703             
00704       This can be used in several ways:
00705 
00706       1) To "brighten" a palette, pass down RGB values that are higher than 100% ( > 255) for all
00707                   three. mono=FALSE.
00708       2) To "darken" a palette, do the same with less than 100% ( < 255) values. mono=FALSE.
00709 
00710       3) To create a "glow" palette, select mono=TRUE, and pass the color in the RGB parameters.
00711 
00712       4) For gamma correction, pass in weighted values for each color.
00713 
00714 **********************************************************************************************/
00715 UINT16 *Create16BPPPaletteShaded( SGPPaletteEntry *pPalette, UINT32 rscale, UINT32 gscale, UINT32 bscale, BOOLEAN mono)
00716 {
00717       UINT16 *p16BPPPalette, r16, g16, b16, usColor;
00718       UINT32 cnt, lumin;
00719       UINT32 rmod, gmod, bmod;
00720       UINT8  r,g,b;
00721 
00722       Assert( pPalette != NULL );
00723 
00724       p16BPPPalette = (UINT16 *) MemAlloc( sizeof( UINT16 ) * 256 );
00725 
00726       for ( cnt = 0; cnt < 256; cnt++ )
00727       {
00728             if(mono)
00729             {
00730                   lumin=(pPalette[ cnt ].peRed*299/1000)+ (pPalette[ cnt ].peGreen*587/1000)+(pPalette[ cnt ].peBlue*114/1000);
00731                   rmod=(rscale*lumin)/256;
00732                   gmod=(gscale*lumin)/256;
00733                   bmod=(bscale*lumin)/256;
00734             }
00735             else
00736             {
00737                   rmod = (rscale*pPalette[ cnt ].peRed/256);
00738                   gmod = (gscale*pPalette[ cnt ].peGreen/256);
00739                   bmod = (bscale*pPalette[ cnt ].peBlue/256);
00740             }
00741             
00742             r = (UINT8)__min(rmod, 255);
00743             g = (UINT8)__min(gmod, 255);
00744             b = (UINT8)__min(bmod, 255);
00745 
00746             if(gusRedShift < 0)
00747                   r16=((UINT16)r>>(-gusRedShift));
00748             else
00749                   r16=((UINT16)r<<gusRedShift);
00750 
00751             if(gusGreenShift < 0)
00752                   g16=((UINT16)g>>(-gusGreenShift));
00753             else
00754                   g16=((UINT16)g<<gusGreenShift);
00755 
00756 
00757             if(gusBlueShift < 0)
00758                   b16=((UINT16)b>>(-gusBlueShift));
00759             else
00760                   b16=((UINT16)b<<gusBlueShift);
00761 
00762             // Prevent creation of pure black color
00763             usColor     = (r16&gusRedMask)|(g16&gusGreenMask)|(b16&gusBlueMask);
00764 
00765             if(usColor==0)
00766             {
00767                   if((r+g+b)!=0)
00768                         usColor=BLACK_SUBSTITUTE | gusAlphaMask;
00769             }
00770             else
00771                   usColor |= gusAlphaMask;
00772 
00773             p16BPPPalette[ cnt ] = usColor;
00774       }
00775       return( p16BPPPalette );
00776 }
00777 
00778 // Convert from RGB to 16 bit value
00779 UINT16 Get16BPPColor( UINT32 RGBValue )
00780 {
00781       UINT16 r16, g16, b16, usColor;
00782       UINT8  r,g,b;
00783 
00784       r = SGPGetRValue( RGBValue );
00785       g = SGPGetGValue( RGBValue );
00786       b = SGPGetBValue( RGBValue );
00787 
00788       if(gusRedShift < 0)
00789             r16=((UINT16)r>>abs(gusRedShift));
00790       else
00791             r16=((UINT16)r<<gusRedShift);
00792 
00793       if(gusGreenShift < 0)
00794             g16=((UINT16)g>>abs(gusGreenShift));
00795       else
00796             g16=((UINT16)g<<gusGreenShift);
00797 
00798 
00799       if(gusBlueShift < 0)
00800             b16=((UINT16)b>>abs(gusBlueShift));
00801       else
00802             b16=((UINT16)b<<gusBlueShift);
00803 
00804       usColor=(r16&gusRedMask)|(g16&gusGreenMask)|(b16&gusBlueMask);
00805 
00806       // if our color worked out to absolute black, and the original wasn't
00807       // absolute black, convert it to a VERY dark grey to avoid transparency
00808       // problems
00809 
00810       if(usColor==0)
00811       {
00812             if(RGBValue!=0)
00813                   usColor=BLACK_SUBSTITUTE | gusAlphaMask;
00814       }
00815       else
00816             usColor     |=    gusAlphaMask;
00817 
00818       return(usColor);
00819 }
00820 
00821 
00822 // Convert from 16 BPP to RGBvalue
00823 UINT32 GetRGBColor( UINT16 Value16BPP )
00824 {
00825       UINT16 r16, g16, b16;
00826       UINT32 r,g,b,val;
00827 
00828       r16 = Value16BPP & gusRedMask;
00829       g16 = Value16BPP & gusGreenMask;
00830       b16 = Value16BPP & gusBlueMask;
00831 
00832       if(gusRedShift < 0)
00833             r=((UINT32)r16<<abs(gusRedShift));
00834       else
00835             r=((UINT32)r16>>gusRedShift);
00836 
00837       if(gusGreenShift < 0)
00838             g=((UINT32)g16<<abs(gusGreenShift));
00839       else
00840             g=((UINT32)g16>>gusGreenShift);
00841 
00842       if(gusBlueShift < 0)
00843             b=((UINT32)b16<<abs(gusBlueShift));
00844       else
00845             b=((UINT32)b16>>gusBlueShift);
00846 
00847       r &= 0x000000ff;
00848       g &= 0x000000ff;
00849       b &= 0x000000ff;
00850 
00851       val = FROMRGB(r,g,b);
00852 
00853       return(val);
00854 }

00856 //*****************************************************************************
00857 //
00858 // ConvertToPaletteEntry
00859 //
00860 // Parameter List : Converts from RGB to SGPPaletteEntry
00861 //
00862 // Return Value  pointer to the SGPPaletteEntry
00863 //               
00864 // Modification History :
00865 // Dec 15th 1996 -> modified for use by Wizardry
00866 //
00867 //*****************************************************************************
00868 
00869 SGPPaletteEntry *ConvertRGBToPaletteEntry(UINT8 sbStart, UINT8 sbEnd, UINT8 *pOldPalette)
00870 {
00871       UINT16 Index;
00872   SGPPaletteEntry *pPalEntry;
00873       SGPPaletteEntry *pInitEntry;
00874 
00875       pPalEntry = (SGPPaletteEntry *)MemAlloc(sizeof(SGPPaletteEntry) * 256);
00876       pInitEntry = pPalEntry;
00877   DbgMessage(TOPIC_HIMAGE, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Converting RGB palette to SGPPaletteEntry");   
00878   for(Index=0; Index <= (sbEnd-sbStart);Index++)
00879   {
00880     pPalEntry->peRed = *(pOldPalette + (Index*3));
00881         pPalEntry->peGreen = *(pOldPalette + (Index*3) + 1);
00882         pPalEntry->peBlue = *(pOldPalette + (Index*3) + 2);
00883     pPalEntry->peFlags = 0;
00884         pPalEntry++;
00885   }
00886   return pInitEntry;
00887 }

00889 BOOLEAN GetETRLEImageData( HIMAGE hImage, ETRLEData *pBuffer )
00890 {
00891       // Assertions
00892       Assert( hImage != NULL );
00893       Assert( pBuffer != NULL );
00894 
00895       // Create memory for data
00896       pBuffer->usNumberOfObjects = hImage->usNumberOfObjects;
00897 
00898       // Create buffer for objects
00899       pBuffer->pETRLEObject = (ETRLEObject *) MemAlloc( sizeof( ETRLEObject ) * pBuffer->usNumberOfObjects );
00900       CHECKF( pBuffer->pETRLEObject != NULL );
00901 
00902       // Copy into buffer
00903       memcpy( pBuffer->pETRLEObject, hImage->pETRLEObject, sizeof( ETRLEObject ) * pBuffer->usNumberOfObjects );
00904 
00905       // Allocate memory for pixel data
00906       pBuffer->pPixData = MemAlloc( hImage->uiSizePixData );
00907       CHECKF( pBuffer->pPixData != NULL );
00908 
00909       pBuffer->uiSizePixData = hImage->uiSizePixData;
00910 
00911       // Copy into buffer
00912       memcpy( pBuffer->pPixData, hImage->pPixData8, pBuffer->uiSizePixData );
00913 
00914       return( TRUE );
00915 }
00916 
00917 void ConvertRGBDistribution565To555( UINT16 * p16BPPData, UINT32 uiNumberOfPixels )
00918 {
00919       UINT16 *    pPixel;
00920       UINT32            uiLoop;
00921       
00922       SplitUINT32       Pixel;
00923 
00924       pPixel = p16BPPData;
00925       for (uiLoop = 0; uiLoop < uiNumberOfPixels; uiLoop++)
00926       {
00927             // If the pixel is completely black, don't bother converting it -- DB
00928             if(*pPixel!=0)
00929             {
00930                   // we put the 16 pixel bits in the UPPER word of uiPixel, so that we can
00931                   // right shift the blue value (at the bottom) into the LOWER word to protect it
00932                   Pixel.usHigher = *pPixel;
00933                   Pixel.uiValue >>= 5;
00934                   // get rid of the least significant bit of green
00935                   Pixel.usHigher >>= 1;
00936                   // now shift back into the upper word
00937                   Pixel.uiValue <<= 5;
00938                   // and copy back
00939                   *pPixel = Pixel.usHigher | gusAlphaMask;
00940             }
00941             pPixel++;
00942       }
00943 }
00944 
00945 void ConvertRGBDistribution565To655( UINT16 * p16BPPData, UINT32 uiNumberOfPixels )
00946 {
00947       UINT16 *    pPixel;
00948       UINT32            uiLoop;
00949       
00950       SplitUINT32       Pixel;
00951 
00952       pPixel = p16BPPData;
00953       for (uiLoop = 0; uiLoop < uiNumberOfPixels; uiLoop++)
00954       {
00955             // we put the 16 pixel bits in the UPPER word of uiPixel, so that we can
00956             // right shift the blue value (at the bottom) into the LOWER word to protect it
00957             Pixel.usHigher = *pPixel;
00958             Pixel.uiValue >>= 5;
00959             // get rid of the least significant bit of green
00960             Pixel.usHigher >>= 1;
00961             // shift to the right some more...
00962             Pixel.uiValue >>= 5;
00963             // so we can left-shift the red value alone to give it an extra bit
00964             Pixel.usHigher <<= 1;
00965             // now shift back and copy
00966             Pixel.uiValue <<= 10;
00967             *pPixel = Pixel.usHigher;
00968             pPixel++;
00969       }
00970 }
00971 
00972 void ConvertRGBDistribution565To556( UINT16 * p16BPPData, UINT32 uiNumberOfPixels )
00973 {
00974       UINT16 *    pPixel;
00975       UINT32            uiLoop;
00976       
00977       SplitUINT32       Pixel;
00978 
00979       pPixel = p16BPPData;
00980       for (uiLoop = 0; uiLoop < uiNumberOfPixels; uiLoop++)
00981       {
00982             // we put the 16 pixel bits in the UPPER word of uiPixel, so that we can
00983             // right shift the blue value (at the bottom) into the LOWER word to protect it
00984             Pixel.usHigher = *pPixel;
00985             Pixel.uiValue >>= 5;
00986             // get rid of the least significant bit of green
00987             Pixel.usHigher >>= 1;
00988             // shift back into the upper word
00989             Pixel.uiValue <<= 5;
00990             // give blue an extra bit (blank in the least significant spot)
00991             Pixel.usHigher <<= 1;
00992             // copy back
00993             *pPixel = Pixel.usHigher;
00994             pPixel++;
00995       }
00996 }
00997 
00998 void ConvertRGBDistribution565ToAny( UINT16 * p16BPPData, UINT32 uiNumberOfPixels )
00999 {
01000       UINT16 *    pPixel;
01001       UINT32            uiRed, uiGreen, uiBlue, uiTemp, uiLoop;
01002 
01003       pPixel = p16BPPData;
01004       for (uiLoop = 0; uiLoop < uiNumberOfPixels; uiLoop++)
01005       {
01006             // put the 565 RGB 16-bit value into a 32-bit RGB value
01007             uiRed = (*pPixel) >> 11;
01008             uiGreen = (*pPixel & 0x07E0) >> 5;
01009             uiBlue = (*pPixel & 0x001F);
01010             uiTemp = FROMRGB(uiRed,uiGreen,uiBlue);
01011             // then convert the 32-bit RGB value to whatever 16 bit format is used
01012             *pPixel = Get16BPPColor( uiTemp );
01013             pPixel++;
01014       }
01015 }
